data.text:
IOW, there is little science-based justification for dropping mask mandates right now or for easing up on getting folks vaccinated and boosted.

COVID is still a serious and widespread disease.

But we're being guided by political and emotional reasoning, not data.

So here are data suggesting our denominator - the number of new cases we're comparing deaths to - is indeed seriously undercounted. What it implies isn't the new variants are more deadly...it's that you're more likely to be exposed to COVID. 

https://t.co/hRT5lLWMbj

@nazgul @CRA1G Or some variation. Vaccinated individuals who home test positive aren't represented in the numbers. We don't know the real numbers. We don't even know if asymptomatic positive cases are quarantining.
@theonides @nazgul @CRA1G Data is nowhere near as good as it ought to be by now *long-winded rant about Trump admin* (I think we can all agree to take that as read, yes?

@nazgul @CRA1G Lots of people don't report the results of home tests. Only PCR tests are automatically counted.

Maybe other factors too.
@CRA1G Vaxxed folks not reporting positive cases, thus increasing the already existing high percentage of unvaxxed?
@BMcCoy06_The @CRA1G I've participated in the Outbreaks Near Me program for years and I did report when I had it, but I don't know if that data makes it into the statistics.
@CRA1G Home tests arenâ€™t part of the case count.
@CRA1G i know i am being very cautious during the 4 weeks post-Bengals SuperBowl Parties period
